page.title: 11Connetts Farm Eastchurch
page.content: The farmer runs a 135 acre farm which has been in the family since 1956, though he has only been{farming}it during the last 5 years. Along with 2 assistants he operates a mixed farming system enabling him to rotate{crops.}"Also," says the farmer "we work on the theory that should one crop prove a disaster the others may make up for it." Recent trends affecting Connetts include the use of new chemicals, increased{farm mechanisation}(all machinery is farmer owned) and the introduction of more prolific breeds of{sheep.} The winter of 1984/5 was bad and this resulted in a very good tilth where the land had been ploughed in the autumn but the sheep in the fields were hit very hard.
